Award.AwardTitle: I-Corps: Interactive Multimodal Data Platform for Bridging Strategic Planning & Thinking
Award.AbstractNarration:
From choosing the right cup of coffee to shaping a company's long-term vision, people continually rely on data analysis and information synthesis to optimize their decisions on both the micro- and macro-levels. Strategic planning and strategic thinking play critical and mutually co-dependent roles in helping one make informed and optimal choices. To assist in the optimization of this process, this I-Corps team has developed an Interactive Multimodal Data Platform for Bridging Strategic Planning & Thinking. It leverages spatially-aware representation of data and focuses on methodologies that minimize bias to promote comprehension and identification of relationships among contextually related data points. The platform enables a study of the ensuing landscape from multiple vantage points, thereby promoting contextual awareness, focus, and ultimately the analysis of the existing data and its synthesis to promote optimal visioning outcomes. Since its inception, the project has attracted attention from two large-scale customers seeking to optimize their organization and project structure with two additional projects currently pending. Based on these developments the team believes the platform may have a potential for a viable business model, with particular focus on professionals and organizations looking to optimize their workflows and jointly explore the data for planning and visioning purposes.

The proposed research will provide insight into the platform's commercial potential as well as help identify key elements that have attracted customer attention. Based on customer feedback, the platform has the potential to affect many aspects of our lives, scaling from individual to organizational, and immediate to long-term. Particular areas of interest are the augmenting professional networking strategies and facilitating organizational self-reflection, restructuring, optimization, and visioning. Furthermore, the platform's integrated approach to data analysis and human-centric synthesis may prove helpful particularly in open-ended tasks and may yield new strategies towards extracting information from the big data. Finally, if the team is successful in this venture, their company will improve the regional economy of southwestern Virginia, which has significantly higher poverty rates and lower average incomes than the state and national averages.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Strategic planning and strategic thinking, or data analysis and synthesis play critical complementing roles in helping us make informed and optimal choices. However, teams often find it a complex and challenging to distinguish between the two, or more importantly, bridge these tasks. The purpose of this project, an Interactive Multimodal Data Platform for Bridging Strategic Planning & Thinking, was to address these challenges by rendering a dynamically evolving spatial network of relationships to present the data from multiple vantage points. This helps users to develop a stronger and more informed vision of what the goal/task was, is, and what it ought or may be. By bridging strategic planning (analysis) and strategic thinking (synthesis), the Orb promotes optimal near- and long-term visioning outcomes.

 

As part of the customer discovery, we found alumni relations and advancement offices to be the best initial customer segment for our application. Our interviews also revealed that the lack of proper donor affinity data, and consequently dead information leads, were the most pressing problems that they faced. This also resulted in officers spending a lot more time sorting and extracting potentially useful information instead of actually cultivating the donor relationship. We found that our platform has a potential address this challenge by encouraging alumni to willingly provide affinity based data based on their interests and passions and not merely publicly available records, while offering in return benefits and opportunities for networking.

 

The intellectual merit of the prototype that has served as a foundation for this project includes the technical aspects of extracting data points to visualize and interact with other interconnected data points while also allowing users to navigate the database landscape in a spatially- and contextually-aware multimodal fashion. The I-Corps experience further offers an invaluable insight in the initial market segment, a better understanding of the customer discovery process and optimal startup strategies, and ultimately clarity on whether this project should be pursued further. Based on the obtained data, the project’s viability remains inconclusive and for this reason we continue to pursue its potential deployment through the newfound partners.

 

The broader impacts of the SP&T Bridge model to analyzing data and synthesizing it into visioning information include the potential to optimize networking strategies and the way how we can optimize our own time as well as our company’s resources, including visioning and restructuring. Such an integrated approach to data analysis and human-centric synthesis may yield new strategies towards extracting information from the big data and potentially lead towards new discoveries that further optimize existing or establish an entirely new research domains.
